  17263. * production for a qualified columnref, because we cannot tell which we
  17264. * are parsing until we see what comes after it ('(' or Sconst for a func_name,
  17265. * anything else for a columnref).  Therefore we allow 'indirection' which
  17266. * may contain subscripts, and reject that case in the C code.  (If we
  17267. * ever implement SQL99-like methods, such syntax may actually become legal!)
  17268. */
  17269. func_name:    type_function_name
  17270.                     { $$ = list_make1(makeString($1)); }
  17271.             | ColId indirection
  17272.                     {
  17273.                         $$ = check_func_name(lcons(makeString($1), $2),
  17274.                                              yyscanner);
  17275.                     }
  17276.         ;


  17279. /*
  17280. * Constants
  17281. */
  17282. AexprConst: Iconst
  17283.                 {
  17284.                     $$ = makeIntConst($1, @1);
  17285.                 }
  17286.             | FCONST
  17287.                 {
  17288.                     $$ = makeFloatConst($1, @1);
  17289.                 }
  17290.             | Sconst
  17291.                 {
  17292.                     $$ = makeStringConst($1, @1);
  17293.                 }
  17294.             | BCONST
  17295.                 {
  17296.                     $$ = makeBitStringConst($1, @1);
  17297.                 }
  17298.             | XCONST
  17299.                 {
  17300.                     /* This is a bit constant per SQL99:
  17301.                      * Without Feature F511, "BIT data type",
  17302.                      * a <general literal> shall not be a
  17303.                      * <bit string literal> or a <hex string literal>.
  17304.                      */
  17305.                     $$ = makeBitStringConst($1, @1);
  17306.                 }
  17307.             | func_name Sconst
  17308.                 {
  17309.                     /* generic type 'literal' syntax */
  17310.                     TypeName   *t = makeTypeNameFromNameList($1);

  17312.                     t->location = @1;
  17313.                     $$ = makeStringConstCast($2, @2, t);
  17314.                 }
  17315.             | func_name '(' func_arg_list opt_sort_clause ')' Sconst
  17316.                 {
  17317.                     /* generic syntax with a type modifier */
  17318.                     TypeName   *t = makeTypeNameFromNameList($1);
  17319.                     ListCell   *lc;

  17321.                     /*
  17322.                      * We must use func_arg_list and opt_sort_clause in the
  17323.                      * production to avoid reduce/reduce conflicts, but we
  17324.                      * don't actually wish to allow NamedArgExpr in this
  17325.                      * context, nor ORDER BY.
  17326.                      */
  17327.                     foreach(lc, $3)
  17328.                     {
  17329.                         NamedArgExpr *arg = (NamedArgExpr *) lfirst(lc);

  17331.                         if (IsA(arg, NamedArgExpr))
  17332.                             ereport(ERROR,
  17333.                                     (errcode(ERRCODE_SYNTAX_ERROR),
  17334.                                      errmsg("type modifier cannot have parameter name"),
  17335.                                      parser_errposition(arg->location)));
  17336.                     }
  17337.                     if ($4 != NIL)
  17338.                             ereport(ERROR,
  17339.                                     (errcode(ERRCODE_SYNTAX_ERROR),
  17340.                                      errmsg("type modifier cannot have ORDER BY"),
  17341.                                      parser_errposition(@4)));

  17343.                     t->typmods = $3;
  17344.                     t->location = @1;
  17345.                     $$ = makeStringConstCast($6, @6, t);
  17346.                 }
  17347.             | ConstTypename Sconst
  17348.                 {
  17349.                     $$ = makeStringConstCast($2, @2, $1);
  17350.                 }
  17351.             | ConstInterval Sconst opt_interval
  17352.                 {
  17353.                     TypeName   *t = $1;

  17355.                     t->typmods = $3;
  17356.                     $$ = makeStringConstCast($2, @2, t);
  17357.                 }
  17358.             | ConstInterval '(' Iconst ')' Sconst
  17359.                 {
  17360.                     TypeName   *t = $1;

  17362.                     t->typmods = list_make2(makeIntConst(INTERVAL_FULL_RANGE, -1),
  17363.                                             makeIntConst($3, @3));
  17364.                     $$ = makeStringConstCast($5, @5, t);
  17365.                 }
  17366.             | TRUE_P
  17367.                 {
  17368.                     $$ = makeBoolAConst(true, @1);
  17369.                 }
  17370.             | FALSE_P
  17371.                 {
  17372.                     $$ = makeBoolAConst(false, @1);
  17373.                 }
  17374.             | NULL_P
  17375.                 {
  17376.                     $$ = makeNullAConst(@1);
  17377.                 }
  17378.         ;

  17380. Iconst:        ICONST                                    { $$ = $1; };
  17381. Sconst:        SCONST                                    { $$ = $1; };

  17383. SignedIconst: Iconst                                { $$ = $1; }
  17384.             | '+' Iconst                            { $$ = + $2; }
  17385.             | '-' Iconst                            { $$ = - $2; }
  17386.         ;

  17388. /* Role specifications */
  17389. RoleId:        RoleSpec
  17390.                 {
  17391.                     RoleSpec   *spc = (RoleSpec *) $1;

  17393.                     switch (spc->roletype)
  17394.                     {
  17395.                         case ROLESPEC_CSTRING:
  17396.                             $$ = spc->rolename;
  17397.                             break;
  17398.                         case ROLESPEC_PUBLIC:
  17399.                             ereport(ERROR,
  17400.                                     (errcode(ERRCODE_RESERVED_NAME),
  17401.                                      errmsg("role name \"%s\" is reserved",
  17402.                                             "public"),
  17403.                                      parser_errposition(@1)));
  17404.                             break;
  17405.                         case ROLESPEC_SESSION_USER:
  17406.                             ereport(ERROR,
  17407.                                     (errcode(ERRCODE_RESERVED_NAME),
  17408.                                      errmsg("%s cannot be used as a role name here",
  17409.                                             "SESSION_USER"),
  17410.                                      parser_errposition(@1)));
  17411.                             break;
  17412.                         case ROLESPEC_CURRENT_USER:
  17413.                             ereport(ERROR,
  17414.                                     (errcode(ERRCODE_RESERVED_NAME),
  17415.                                      errmsg("%s cannot be used as a role name here",
  17416.                                             "CURRENT_USER"),
  17417.                                      parser_errposition(@1)));
  17418.                             break;
  17419.                         case ROLESPEC_CURRENT_ROLE:
  17420.                             ereport(ERROR,
  17421.                                     (errcode(ERRCODE_RESERVED_NAME),
  17422.                                      errmsg("%s cannot be used as a role name here",
  17423.                                             "CURRENT_ROLE"),
  17424.                                      parser_errposition(@1)));
  17425.                             break;
  17426.                     }
  17427.                 }
  17428.             ;

  17430. RoleSpec:    NonReservedWord
  17431.                 {
  17432.                     /*
  17433.                      * "public" and "none" are not keywords, but they must
  17434.                      * be treated specially here.
  17435.                      */
  17436.                     RoleSpec   *n;

  17438.                     if (strcmp($1, "public") == 0)
  17439.                     {
  17440.                         n = (RoleSpec *) makeRoleSpec(ROLESPEC_PUBLIC, @1);
  17441.                         n->roletype = ROLESPEC_PUBLIC;
  17442.                     }
  17443.                     else if (strcmp($1, "none") == 0)
  17444.                     {
  17445.                         ereport(ERROR,
  17446.                                 (errcode(ERRCODE_RESERVED_NAME),
  17447.                                  errmsg("role name \"%s\" is reserved",
  17448.                                         "none"),
  17449.                                  parser_errposition(@1)));
  17450.                     }
  17451.                     else
  17452.                     {
  17453.                         n = makeRoleSpec(ROLESPEC_CSTRING, @1);
  17454.                         n->rolename = pstrdup($1);
  17455.                     }
  17456.                     $$ = n;
  17457.                 }
  17458.             | CURRENT_ROLE
  17459.                 {
  17460.                     $$ = makeRoleSpec(ROLESPEC_CURRENT_ROLE, @1);
  17461.                 }
  17462.             | CURRENT_USER
  17463.                 {
  17464.                     $$ = makeRoleSpec(ROLESPEC_CURRENT_USER, @1);
  17465.                 }
  17466.             | SESSION_USER
  17467.                 {
  17468.                     $$ = makeRoleSpec(ROLESPEC_SESSION_USER, @1);
  17469.                 }
  17470.         ;

  17472. role_list:    RoleSpec
  17473.                 { $$ = list_make1($1); }
  17474.             | role_list ',' RoleSpec
  17475.                 { $$ = lappend($1, $3); }
  17476.         ;


  17479. /*****************************************************************************
  17480. *
  17481. * PL/pgSQL extensions
  17482. *
  17483. * You'd think a PL/pgSQL "expression" should be just an a_expr, but
  17484. * historically it can include just about anything that can follow SELECT.
  17485. * Therefore the returned struct is a SelectStmt.
  17486. *****************************************************************************/

  17488. PLpgSQL_Expr: opt_distinct_clause opt_target_list
  17489.             from_clause where_clause
  17490.             group_clause having_clause window_clause
  17491.             opt_sort_clause opt_select_limit opt_for_locking_clause
  17492.                 {
  17493.                     SelectStmt *n = makeNode(SelectStmt);

  17495.                     n->distinctClause = $1;
  17496.                     n->targetList = $2;
  17497.                     n->fromClause = $3;
  17498.                     n->whereClause = $4;
  17499.                     n->groupClause = ($5)->list;
  17500.                     n->groupDistinct = ($5)->distinct;
  17501.                     n->havingClause = $6;
  17502.                     n->windowClause = $7;
  17503.                     n->sortClause = $8;
  17504.                     if ($9)
  17505.                     {
  17506.                         n->limitOffset = $9->limitOffset;
  17507.                         n->limitCount = $9->limitCount;
  17508.                         if (!n->sortClause &&
  17509.                             $9->limitOption == LIMIT_OPTION_WITH_TIES)
  17510.                             ereport(ERROR,
  17511.                                     (errcode(ERRCODE_SYNTAX_ERROR),
  17512.                                      errmsg("WITH TIES cannot be specified without ORDER BY clause")));
  17513.                         n->limitOption = $9->limitOption;
  17514.                     }
  17515.                     n->lockingClause = $10;
  17516.                     $$ = (Node *) n;
  17517.                 }
  17518.         ;

  17520. /*
  17521. * PL/pgSQL Assignment statement: name opt_indirection := PLpgSQL_Expr
  17522. */

  17524. PLAssignStmt: plassign_target opt_indirection plassign_equals PLpgSQL_Expr
  17525.                 {
  17526.                     PLAssignStmt *n = makeNode(PLAssignStmt);

  17528.                     n->name = $1;
  17529.                     n->indirection = check_indirection($2, yyscanner);
  17530.                     /* nnames will be filled by calling production */
  17531.                     n->val = (SelectStmt *) $4;
  17532.                     n->location = @1;
  17533.                     $$ = (Node *) n;
  17534.                 }
  17535.         ;

  17537. plassign_target: ColId                            { $$ = $1; }
  17538.             | PARAM                                { $$ = psprintf("$%d", $1); }
  17539.         ;

  17541. plassign_equals: COLON_EQUALS
  17542.             | '='
  17543.         ;


  17546. /*
  17547. * Name classification hierarchy.
  17548. *
  17549. * IDENT is the lexeme returned by the lexer for identifiers that match
  17550. * no known keyword.  In most cases, we can accept certain keywords as
  17551. * names, not only IDENTs.    We prefer to accept as many such keywords
  17552. * as possible to minimize the impact of "reserved words" on programmers.
  17553. * So, we divide names into several possible classes.  The classification
  17554. * is chosen in part to make keywords acceptable as names wherever possible.
  17555. */

  17557. /* Column identifier --- names that can be column, table, etc names.
  17558. */
  17559. ColId:        IDENT                                    { $$ = $1; }
  17560.             | unreserved_keyword                    { $$ = pstrdup($1); }
  17561.             | col_name_keyword                        { $$ = pstrdup($1); }
  17562.         ;

  17564. /* Type/function identifier --- names that can be type or function names.
  17565. */
  17566. type_function_name:    IDENT                            { $$ = $1; }
  17567.             | unreserved_keyword                    { $$ = pstrdup($1); }
  17568.             | type_func_name_keyword                { $$ = pstrdup($1); }
  17569.         ;

  17571. /* Any not-fully-reserved word --- these names can be, eg, role names.
  17572. */
  17573. NonReservedWord:    IDENT                            { $$ = $1; }
  17574.             | unreserved_keyword                    { $$ = pstrdup($1); }
  17575.             | col_name_keyword                        { $$ = pstrdup($1); }
  17576.             | type_func_name_keyword                { $$ = pstrdup($1); }
  17577.         ;

  17579. /* Column label --- allowed labels in "AS" clauses.
  17580. * This presently includes *all* Postgres keywords.
  17581. */
  17582. ColLabel:    IDENT                                    { $$ = $1; }
  17583.             | unreserved_keyword                    { $$ = pstrdup($1); }
  17584.             | col_name_keyword                        { $$ = pstrdup($1); }
  17585.             | type_func_name_keyword                { $$ = pstrdup($1); }
  17586.             | reserved_keyword                        { $$ = pstrdup($1); }
  17587.         ;

  17589. /* Bare column label --- names that can be column labels without writing "AS".
  17590. * This classification is orthogonal to the other keyword categories.
  17591. */
  17592. BareColLabel:    IDENT                                { $$ = $1; }
  17593.             | bare_label_keyword                    { $$ = pstrdup($1); }
  17594.         ;


  17597. /*
  17598. * Keyword category lists.  Generally, every keyword present in
  17599. * the Postgres grammar should appear in exactly one of these lists.
  17600. *
  17601. * Put a new keyword into the first list that it can go into without causing
  17602. * shift or reduce conflicts.  The earlier lists define "less reserved"
  17603. * categories of keywords.
  17604. *
  17605. * Make sure that each keyword's category in kwlist.h matches where
  17606. * it is listed here.  (Someday we may be able to generate these lists and
  17607. * kwlist.h's table from one source of truth.)
  17608. */

  17610. /* "Unreserved" keywords --- available for use as any kind of name.
  17611. */
  17612. unreserved_keyword:
  17613.               ABORT_P
  17614.             | ABSENT
  17615.             | ABSOLUTE_P
  17616.             | ACCESS
  17617.             | ACTION
  17618.             | ADD_P
  17619.             | ADMIN
  17620.             | AFTER
  17621.             | AGGREGATE
  17622.             | ALSO
  17623.             | ALTER
  17624.             | ALWAYS
  17625.             | ASENSITIVE
  17626.             | ASSERTION
  17627.             | ASSIGNMENT
  17628.             | AT
  17629.             | ATOMIC
  17630.             | ATTACH
  17631.             | ATTRIBUTE
  17632.             | BACKWARD
  17633.             | BEFORE
  17634.             | BEGIN_P
  17635.             | BREADTH
  17636.             | BY
  17637.             | CACHE
  17638.             | CALL

  17640.             | CASCADE
  17641.             | CASCADED
  17642.             | CATALOG_P
  17643.             | CHAIN
  17644.             | CHARACTERISTICS

  17646.             | CLASS
  17647.             | CLOSE
  17648.             | CLUSTER
  17649.             | COLUMNS
  17650.             | COMMENT
  17651.             | COMMENTS
  17652.             | COMMIT
  17653.             | COMMITTED
  17654.             | COMPRESSION
  17655.             | CONDITIONAL
  17656.             | CONFIGURATION
  17657.             | CONFLICT
  17658.             | CONNECTION
  17659.             | CONSTRAINTS
  17660.             | CONTENT_P

  17663.             | COPY
  17664.             | COST
  17665.             | CSV
  17666.             | CUBE
  17667.             | CURRENT_P
  17668.             | CURSOR
  17669.             | CYCLE
  17670.             | DATA_P
  17671.             | DATABASE
  17672.             | DAY_P
  17673.             | DEALLOCATE

  17676.             | DEFERRED
  17677.             | DEFINER
  17678.             | DELETE_P
  17679.             | DELIMITER
  17680.             | DELIMITERS
  17681.             | DEPENDS
  17682.             | DEPTH
  17683.             | DETACH
  17684.             | DICTIONARY
  17685.             | DISABLE_P
  17686.             | DISCARD
  17687.             | DOCUMENT_P
  17688.             | DOMAIN_P
  17689.             | DOUBLE_P
  17690.             | DROP
  17691.             | EACH
  17692.             | EMPTY_P

  17694.             | ENCODING

  17928.             | VARYING

  17930.             | VIEW
  17931.             | VIEWS
  17932.             | VOLATILE
  17933.             | WHITESPACE_P
  17934.             | WITHIN
  17935.             | WITHOUT
  17936.             | WORK
  17937.             | WRAPPER
  17938.             | WRITE
  17939.             | XML_P
  17940.             | YEAR_P
  17941.             | YES_P
  17942.             | ZONE
  17943.         ;

  17945. /* Column identifier --- keywords that can be column, table, etc names.
  17946. *
  17947. * Many of these keywords will in fact be recognized as type or function
  17948. * names too; but they have special productions for the purpose, and so
  17949. * can't be treated as "generic" type or function names.
  17950. *
  17951. * The type names appearing here are not usable as function names
  17952. * because they can be followed by '(' in typename productions, which
  17953. * looks too much like a function call for an LR(1) parser.
  17954. */
  17955. col_name_keyword:
  17956.               BETWEEN
  17957.             | BIGINT
  17958.             | BIT
  17959.             | BOOLEAN_P
  17960.             | CHAR_P
  17961.             | CHARACTER
  17962.             | COALESCE
  17963.             | DEC
  17964.             | DECIMAL_P
  17965.             | EXISTS
  17966.             | EXTRACT
  17967.             | FLOAT_P
  17968.             | GREATEST
  17969.             | GROUPING
  17970.             | INOUT
  17971.             | INT_P
  17972.             | INTEGER
  17973.             | INTERVAL
  17974.             | JSON
  17975.             | JSON_ARRAY
  17976.             | JSON_ARRAYAGG
  17977.             | JSON_EXISTS
  17978.             | JSON_OBJECT
  17979.             | JSON_OBJECTAGG
  17980.             | JSON_QUERY
  17981.             | JSON_SCALAR
  17982.             | JSON_SERIALIZE
  17983.             | JSON_TABLE
  17984.             | JSON_VALUE
  17985.             | LEAST
  17986.             | MERGE_ACTION
  17987.             | NATIONAL
  17988.             | NCHAR
  17989.             | NONE
  17990.             | NORMALIZE
  17991.             | NULLIF
  17992.             | NUMERIC
  17993.             | OUT_P
  17994.             | OVERLAY
  17995.             | POSITION
  17996.             | PRECISION
  17997.             | REAL
  17998.             | ROW
  17999.             | SETOF
  18000.             | SMALLINT
  18001.             | SUBSTRING
  18002.             | TIME
  18003.             | TIMESTAMP
  18004.             | TREAT
  18005.             | TRIM
  18006.             | VALUES
  18007.             | VARCHAR
  18008.             | XMLATTRIBUTES
  18009.             | XMLCONCAT
  18010.             | XMLELEMENT
  18011.             | XMLEXISTS
  18012.             | XMLFOREST
  18013.             | XMLNAMESPACES
  18014.             | XMLPARSE
  18015.             | XMLPI
  18016.             | XMLROOT
  18017.             | XMLSERIALIZE
  18018.             | XMLTABLE
  18019.         ;

  18021. /* Type/function identifier --- keywords that can be type or function names.
  18022. *
  18023. * Most of these are keywords that are used as operators in expressions;
  18024. * in general such keywords can't be column names because they would be
  18025. * ambiguous with variables, but they are unambiguous as function identifiers.
  18026. *
  18027. * Do not include POSITION, SUBSTRING, etc here since they have explicit
  18028. * productions in a_expr to support the goofy SQL9x argument syntax.
  18029. * - thomas 2000-11-28
  18030. */
  18031. type_func_name_keyword:
  18032.               AUTHORIZATION
  18033.             | BINARY
  18034.             | COLLATION
  18035.             | CONCURRENTLY
  18036.             | CROSS
  18037.             | CURRENT_SCHEMA
  18038.             | FREEZE
  18039.             | FULL
  18040.             | ILIKE
  18041.             | INNER_P
  18042.             | IS
  18043.             | ISNULL
  18044.             | JOIN
  18045.             | LEFT
  18046.             | LIKE
  18047.             | NATURAL
  18048.             | NOTNULL
  18049.             | OUTER_P
  18050.             | OVERLAPS
  18051.             | RIGHT
  18052.             | SIMILAR
  18053.             | TABLESAMPLE
  18054.             | VERBOSE
  18055.         ;

  18057. /* Reserved keyword --- these keywords are usable only as a ColLabel.
  18058. *
  18059. * Keywords appear here if they could not be distinguished from variable,
  18060. * type, or function names in some contexts.  Don't put things here unless
  18061. * forced to.
  18062. */
  18063. reserved_keyword:
  18064.               ALL
  18065.             | ANALYSE
  18066.             | ANALYZE
  18067.             | AND
  18068.             | ANY
  18069.             | ARRAY
  18070.             | AS

  18142.         ;

  18144. /*
  18145. * While all keywords can be used as column labels when preceded by AS,
  18146. * not all of them can be used as a "bare" column label without AS.
  18147. * Those that can be used as a bare label must be listed here,
  18148. * in addition to appearing in one of the category lists above.
  18149. *
  18150. * Always add a new keyword to this list if possible.  Mark it BARE_LABEL
  18151. * in kwlist.h if it is included here, or AS_LABEL if it is not.
  18152. */
  18153. bare_label_keyword:
  18154.               ABORT_P
  18155.             | ABSENT
  18156.             | ABSOLUTE_P

  18576.             | USING
  18577.             | VACUUM
  18578.             | VALID
  18579.             | VALIDATE
  18580.             | VALIDATOR
  18581.             | VALUE_P
  18582.             | VALUES
  18583.             | VARCHAR
  18584.             | VARIADIC
  18585.             | VERBOSE
  18586.             | VERSION_P
  18587.             | VIEW
  18588.             | VIEWS
  18589.             | VOLATILE
  18590.             | WHEN
  18591.             | WHITESPACE_P
  18592.             | WORK
  18593.             | WRAPPER
  18594.             | WRITE
  18595.             | XML_P
  18596.             | XMLATTRIBUTES
  18597.             | XMLCONCAT
  18598.             | XMLELEMENT
  18599.             | XMLEXISTS
  18600.             | XMLFOREST
  18601.             | XMLNAMESPACES
  18602.             | XMLPARSE
  18603.             | XMLPI
  18604.             | XMLROOT
  18605.             | XMLSERIALIZE
  18606.             | XMLTABLE
  18607.             | YES_P
  18608.             | ZONE
  18609.         ;

  18611. %%

  18613. /*
  18614. * The signature of this function is required by bison.  However, we
  18615. * ignore the passed yylloc and instead use the last token position
  18616. * available from the scanner.
  18617. */
  18618. static void
  18619. base_yyerror(YYLTYPE *yylloc, core_yyscan_t yyscanner, const char *msg)
  18620. {
  18621.     parser_yyerror(msg);
  18622. }

  18624. static RawStmt *
  18625. makeRawStmt(Node *stmt, int stmt_location)
  18626. {
  18627.     RawStmt    *rs = makeNode(RawStmt);

  18629.     rs->stmt = stmt;
  18630.     rs->stmt_location = stmt_location;
  18631.     rs->stmt_len = 0;            /* might get changed later */
  18632.     return rs;
  18633. }

  18635. /* Adjust a RawStmt to reflect that it doesn't run to the end of the string */
  18636. static void
  18637. updateRawStmtEnd(RawStmt *rs, int end_location)
  18638. {
  18639.     /*
  18640.      * If we already set the length, don't change it.  This is for situations
  18641.      * like "select foo ;; select bar" where the same statement will be last
  18642.      * in the string for more than one semicolon.
  18643.      */
  18644.     if (rs->stmt_len > 0)
  18645.         return;

  18647.     /* OK, update length of RawStmt */
  18648.     rs->stmt_len = end_location - rs->stmt_location;
  18649. }

  18651. static Node *
  18652. makeColumnRef(char *colname, List *indirection,
  18653.               int location, core_yyscan_t yyscanner)
  18654. {
  18655.     /*
  18656.      * Generate a ColumnRef node, with an A_Indirection node added if there
  18657.      * is any subscripting in the specified indirection list.  However,
  18658.      * any field selection at the start of the indirection list must be
  18659.      * transposed into the "fields" part of the ColumnRef node.
  18660.      */
  18661.     ColumnRef  *c = makeNode(ColumnRef);
  18662.     int            nfields = 0;
  18663.     ListCell   *l;

  18665.     c->location = location;
  18666.     foreach(l, indirection)
  18667.     {
  18668.         if (IsA(lfirst(l), A_Indices))
  18669.         {
  18670.             A_Indirection *i = makeNode(A_Indirection);

  18672.             if (nfields == 0)
  18673.             {
  18674.                 /* easy case - all indirection goes to A_Indirection */
  18675.                 c->fields = list_make1(makeString(colname));
  18676.                 i->indirection = check_indirection(indirection, yyscanner);
  18677.             }
  18678.             else
  18679.             {
  18680.                 /* got to split the list in two */
  18681.                 i->indirection = check_indirection(list_copy_tail(indirection,
  18682.                                                                   nfields),
  18683.                                                    yyscanner);
  18684.                 indirection = list_truncate(indirection, nfields);
  18685.                 c->fields = lcons(makeString(colname), indirection);
  18686.             }
  18687.             i->arg = (Node *) c;
  18688.             return (Node *) i;
  18689.         }
  18690.         else if (IsA(lfirst(l), A_Star))
  18691.         {
  18692.             /* We only allow '*' at the end of a ColumnRef */
  18693.             if (lnext(indirection, l) != NULL)
  18694.                 parser_yyerror("improper use of \"*\"");
  18695.         }
  18696.         nfields++;
  18697.     }
  18698.     /* No subscripting, so all indirection gets added to field list */
  18699.     c->fields = lcons(makeString(colname), indirection);
  18700.     return (Node *) c;
  18701. }

  18703. static Node *
  18704. makeTypeCast(Node *arg, TypeName *typename, int location)
  18705. {
  18706.     TypeCast   *n = makeNode(TypeCast);

  18708.     n->arg = arg;
  18709.     n->typeName = typename;
  18710.     n->location = location;
  18711.     return (Node *) n;
  18712. }

  18714. static Node *
  18715. makeStringConstCast(char *str, int location, TypeName *typename)
  18716. {
  18717.     Node       *s = makeStringConst(str, location);

  18719.     return makeTypeCast(s, typename, -1);
  18720. }

  18722. static Node *
  18723. makeIntConst(int val, int location)
  18724. {
  18725.     A_Const       *n = makeNode(A_Const);

  18727.     n->val.ival.type = T_Integer;
  18728.     n->val.ival.ival = val;
  18729.     n->location = location;

  18731.    return (Node *) n;
  18732. }

  18734. static Node *
  18735. makeFloatConst(char *str, int location)
  18736. {
  18737.     A_Const       *n = makeNode(A_Const);

  18739.     n->val.fval.type = T_Float;
  18740.     n->val.fval.fval = str;
  18741.     n->location = location;

  18743.    return (Node *) n;
  18744. }

  18746. static Node *
  18747. makeBoolAConst(bool state, int location)
  18748. {
  18749.     A_Const       *n = makeNode(A_Const);

  18751.     n->val.boolval.type = T_Boolean;
  18752.     n->val.boolval.boolval = state;
  18753.     n->location = location;

  18755.    return (Node *) n;
  18756. }

  18758. static Node *
  18759. makeBitStringConst(char *str, int location)
  18760. {
  18761.     A_Const       *n = makeNode(A_Const);

  18763.     n->val.bsval.type = T_BitString;
  18764.     n->val.bsval.bsval = str;
  18765.     n->location = location;

  18767.    return (Node *) n;
  18768. }

  18770. static Node *
  18771. makeNullAConst(int location)
  18772. {
  18773.     A_Const       *n = makeNode(A_Const);

  18775.     n->isnull = true;
  18776.     n->location = location;

  18778.     return (Node *) n;
  18779. }

  18781. static Node *
  18782. makeAConst(Node *v, int location)
  18783. {
  18784.     Node       *n;

  18786.     switch (v->type)
  18787.     {
  18788.         case T_Float:
  18789.             n = makeFloatConst(castNode(Float, v)->fval, location);
  18790.             break;

  18792.         case T_Integer:
  18793.             n = makeIntConst(castNode(Integer, v)->ival, location);
  18794.             break;

  18796.         default:
  18797.             /* currently not used */
  18798.             Assert(false);
  18799.             n = NULL;
  18800.     }

  18802.     return n;
  18803. }

  18805. /* makeRoleSpec
  18806. * Create a RoleSpec with the given type
  18807. */
  18808. static RoleSpec *
  18809. makeRoleSpec(RoleSpecType type, int location)
  18810. {
  18811.     RoleSpec   *spec = makeNode(RoleSpec);

  18813.     spec->roletype = type;
  18814.     spec->location = location;

  18816.     return spec;
  18817. }

  18819. /* check_qualified_name --- check the result of qualified_name production
  18820. *
  18821. * It's easiest to let the grammar production for qualified_name allow
  18822. * subscripts and '*', which we then must reject here.
  18823. */
  18824. static void
  18825. check_qualified_name(List *names, core_yyscan_t yyscanner)
  18826. {
  18827.     ListCell   *i;

  18829.     foreach(i, names)
  18830.     {
  18831.         if (!IsA(lfirst(i), String))
  18832.             parser_yyerror("syntax error");
  18833.     }
  18834. }

  18836. /* check_func_name --- check the result of func_name production
  18837. *
  18838. * It's easiest to let the grammar production for func_name allow subscripts
  18839. * and '*', which we then must reject here.
  18840. */
  18841. static List *
  18842. check_func_name(List *names, core_yyscan_t yyscanner)
  18843. {
  18844.     ListCell   *i;

  18846.     foreach(i, names)
  18847.     {
  18848.         if (!IsA(lfirst(i), String))
  18849.             parser_yyerror("syntax error");
  18850.     }
  18851.     return names;
  18852. }

  18854. /* check_indirection --- check the result of indirection production
  18855. *
  18856. * We only allow '*' at the end of the list, but it's hard to enforce that
  18857. * in the grammar, so do it here.
  18858. */
  18859. static List *
  18860. check_indirection(List *indirection, core_yyscan_t yyscanner)
  18861. {
  18862.     ListCell *l;

  18864.     foreach(l, indirection)
  18865.     {
  18866.         if (IsA(lfirst(l), A_Star))
  18867.         {
  18868.             if (lnext(indirection, l) != NULL)
  18869.                 parser_yyerror("improper use of \"*\"");
  18870.         }
  18871.     }
  18872.     return indirection;
  18873. }

  18875. /* extractArgTypes()
  18876. * Given a list of FunctionParameter nodes, extract a list of just the
  18877. * argument types (TypeNames) for input parameters only.  This is what
  18878. * is needed to look up an existing function, which is what is wanted by
  18879. * the productions that use this call.
  18880. */
  18881. static List *
  18882. extractArgTypes(List *parameters)
  18883. {
  18884.     List       *result = NIL;
  18885.     ListCell   *i;

  18887.     foreach(i, parameters)
  18888.     {
  18889.         FunctionParameter *p = (FunctionParameter *) lfirst(i);

  18891.         if (p->mode != FUNC_PARAM_OUT && p->mode != FUNC_PARAM_TABLE)
  18892.             result = lappend(result, p->argType);
  18893.     }
  18894.     return result;
  18895. }

  18897. /* extractAggrArgTypes()
  18898. * As above, but work from the output of the aggr_args production.
  18899. */
  18900. static List *
  18901. extractAggrArgTypes(List *aggrargs)
  18902. {
  18903.     Assert(list_length(aggrargs) == 2);
  18904.     return extractArgTypes((List *) linitial(aggrargs));
  18905. }

  18907. /* makeOrderedSetArgs()
  18908. * Build the result of the aggr_args production (which see the comments for).
  18909. * This handles only the case where both given lists are nonempty, so that
  18910. * we have to deal with multiple VARIADIC arguments.
  18911. */
  18912. static List *
  18913. makeOrderedSetArgs(List *directargs, List *orderedargs,
  18914.                    core_yyscan_t yyscanner)
  18915. {
  18916.     FunctionParameter *lastd = (FunctionParameter *) llast(directargs);
  18917.     Integer       *ndirectargs;

  18919.     /* No restriction unless last direct arg is VARIADIC */
  18920.     if (lastd->mode == FUNC_PARAM_VARIADIC)
  18921.     {
  18922.         FunctionParameter *firsto = (FunctionParameter *) linitial(orderedargs);

  18924.         /*
  18925.          * We ignore the names, though the aggr_arg production allows them;
  18926.          * it doesn't allow default values, so those need not be checked.
  18927.          */
  18928.         if (list_length(orderedargs) != 1 ||
  18929.             firsto->mode != FUNC_PARAM_VARIADIC ||
  18930.             !equal(lastd->argType, firsto->argType))
  18931.             ereport(ERROR,
  18932.                     (errcode(ERRCODE_FEATURE_NOT_SUPPORTED),
  18933.                      errmsg("an ordered-set aggregate with a VARIADIC direct argument must have one VARIADIC aggregated argument of the same data type"),
  18934.                      parser_errposition(exprLocation((Node *) firsto))));

  18936.         /* OK, drop the duplicate VARIADIC argument from the internal form */
  18937.         orderedargs = NIL;
  18938.     }

  18940.     /* don't merge into the next line, as list_concat changes directargs */
  18941.     ndirectargs = makeInteger(list_length(directargs));

  18943.     return list_make2(list_concat(directargs, orderedargs),
  18944.                       ndirectargs);
  18945. }

  18947. /* insertSelectOptions()
  18948. * Insert ORDER BY, etc into an already-constructed SelectStmt.
  18949. *
  18950. * This routine is just to avoid duplicating code in SelectStmt productions.
  18951. */
  18952. static void
  18953. insertSelectOptions(SelectStmt *stmt,
  18954.                     List *sortClause, List *lockingClause,
  18955.                     SelectLimit *limitClause,
  18956.                     WithClause *withClause,
  18957.                     core_yyscan_t yyscanner)
  18958. {
  18959.     Assert(IsA(stmt, SelectStmt));

  18961.     /*
  18962.      * Tests here are to reject constructs like
  18963.      *    (SELECT foo ORDER BY bar) ORDER BY baz
  18964.      */
  18965.     if (sortClause)
  18966.     {
  18967.         if (stmt->sortClause)
  18968.             ereport(ERROR,
  18969.                     (errcode(ERRCODE_SYNTAX_ERROR),
  18970.                      errmsg("multiple ORDER BY clauses not allowed"),
  18971.                      parser_errposition(exprLocation((Node *) sortClause))));
  18972.         stmt->sortClause = sortClause;
  18973.     }
  18974.     /* We can handle multiple locking clauses, though */
  18975.     stmt->lockingClause = list_concat(stmt->lockingClause, lockingClause);
  18976.     if (limitClause && limitClause->limitOffset)
  18977.     {
  18978.         if (stmt->limitOffset)
  18979.             ereport(ERROR,
  18980.                     (errcode(ERRCODE_SYNTAX_ERROR),
  18981.                      errmsg("multiple OFFSET clauses not allowed"),
  18982.                      parser_errposition(exprLocation(limitClause->limitOffset))));
  18983.         stmt->limitOffset = limitClause->limitOffset;
  18984.     }
  18985.     if (limitClause && limitClause->limitCount)
  18986.     {
  18987.         if (stmt->limitCount)
  18988.             ereport(ERROR,
  18989.                     (errcode(ERRCODE_SYNTAX_ERROR),
  18990.                      errmsg("multiple LIMIT clauses not allowed"),
  18991.                      parser_errposition(exprLocation(limitClause->limitCount))));
  18992.         stmt->limitCount = limitClause->limitCount;
  18993.     }
  18994.     if (limitClause)
  18995.     {
  18996.         if (stmt->limitOption)
  18997.             ereport(ERROR,
  18998.                     (errcode(ERRCODE_SYNTAX_ERROR),
  18999.                      errmsg("multiple limit options not allowed")));
  19000.         if (!stmt->sortClause && limitClause->limitOption == LIMIT_OPTION_WITH_TIES)
  19001.             ereport(ERROR,
  19002.                     (errcode(ERRCODE_SYNTAX_ERROR),
  19003.                      errmsg("WITH TIES cannot be specified without ORDER BY clause")));
  19004.         if (limitClause->limitOption == LIMIT_OPTION_WITH_TIES && stmt->lockingClause)
  19005.         {
  19006.             ListCell   *lc;

  19008.             foreach(lc, stmt->lockingClause)
  19009.             {
  19010.                 LockingClause *lock = lfirst_node(LockingClause, lc);

  19012.                 if (lock->waitPolicy == LockWaitSkip)
  19013.                     ereport(ERROR,
  19014.                             (errcode(ERRCODE_SYNTAX_ERROR),
  19015.                              errmsg("%s and %s options cannot be used together",
  19016.                                     "SKIP LOCKED", "WITH TIES")));
  19017.             }
  19018.         }
  19019.         stmt->limitOption = limitClause->limitOption;
  19020.     }
  19021.     if (withClause)
  19022.     {
  19023.         if (stmt->withClause)
  19024.             ereport(ERROR,
  19025.                     (errcode(ERRCODE_SYNTAX_ERROR),
  19026.                      errmsg("multiple WITH clauses not allowed"),
  19027.                      parser_errposition(exprLocation((Node *) withClause))));
  19028.         stmt->withClause = withClause;
  19029.     }
  19030. }

  19032. static Node *
  19033. makeSetOp(SetOperation op, bool all, Node *larg, Node *rarg)
  19034. {
  19035.     SelectStmt *n = makeNode(SelectStmt);

  19037.     n->op = op;
  19038.     n->all = all;
  19039.     n->larg = (SelectStmt *) larg;
  19040.     n->rarg = (SelectStmt *) rarg;
  19041.     return (Node *) n;
  19042. }

  19044. /* SystemFuncName()
  19045. * Build a properly-qualified reference to a built-in function.
  19046. */
  19047. List *
  19048. SystemFuncName(char *name)
  19049. {
  19050.     return list_make2(makeString("pg_catalog"), makeString(name));
  19051. }

  19053. /* SystemTypeName()
  19054. * Build a properly-qualified reference to a built-in type.
  19055. *
  19056. * typmod is defaulted, but may be changed afterwards by caller.
  19057. * Likewise for the location.
  19058. */
  19059. TypeName *
  19060. SystemTypeName(char *name)
  19061. {
  19062.     return makeTypeNameFromNameList(list_make2(makeString("pg_catalog"),
  19063.                                                makeString(name)));
  19064. }

  19066. /* doNegate()
  19067. * Handle negation of a numeric constant.
  19068. *
  19069. * Formerly, we did this here because the optimizer couldn't cope with
  19070. * indexquals that looked like "var = -4" --- it wants "var = const"
  19071. * and a unary minus operator applied to a constant didn't qualify.
  19072. * As of Postgres 7.0, that problem doesn't exist anymore because there
  19073. * is a constant-subexpression simplifier in the optimizer.  However,
  19074. * there's still a good reason for doing this here, which is that we can
  19075. * postpone committing to a particular internal representation for simple
  19076. * negative constants.    It's better to leave "-123.456" in string form
  19077. * until we know what the desired type is.
  19078. */
  19079. static Node *
  19080. doNegate(Node *n, int location)
  19081. {
  19082.     if (IsA(n, A_Const))
  19083.     {
  19084.         A_Const       *con = (A_Const *) n;

  19086.         /* report the constant's location as that of the '-' sign */
  19087.         con->location = location;

  19089.         if (IsA(&con->val, Integer))
  19090.         {
  19091.             con->val.ival.ival = -con->val.ival.ival;
  19092.             return n;
  19093.         }
  19094.         if (IsA(&con->val, Float))
  19095.         {
  19096.             doNegateFloat(&con->val.fval);
  19097.             return n;
  19098.         }
  19099.     }

  19101.     return (Node *) makeSimpleA_Expr(AEXPR_OP, "-", NULL, n, location);
  19102. }

  19104. static void
  19105. doNegateFloat(Float *v)
  19106. {
  19107.     char       *oldval = v->fval;

  19109.     if (*oldval == '+')
  19110.         oldval++;
  19111.     if (*oldval == '-')
  19112.         v->fval = oldval+1;    /* just strip the '-' */
  19113.     else
  19114.         v->fval = psprintf("-%s", oldval);
  19115. }

  19117. static Node *
  19118. makeAndExpr(Node *lexpr, Node *rexpr, int location)
  19119. {
  19120.     /* Flatten "a AND b AND c ..." to a single BoolExpr on sight */
  19121.     if (IsA(lexpr, BoolExpr))
  19122.     {
  19123.         BoolExpr   *blexpr = (BoolExpr *) lexpr;

  19125.         if (blexpr->boolop == AND_EXPR)
  19126.         {
  19127.             blexpr->args = lappend(blexpr->args, rexpr);
  19128.             return (Node *) blexpr;
  19129.         }
  19130.     }
  19131.     return (Node *) makeBoolExpr(AND_EXPR, list_make2(lexpr, rexpr), location);
  19132. }

  19134. static Node *
  19135. makeOrExpr(Node *lexpr, Node *rexpr, int location)
  19136. {
  19137.     /* Flatten "a OR b OR c ..." to a single BoolExpr on sight */
  19138.     if (IsA(lexpr, BoolExpr))
  19139.     {
  19140.         BoolExpr   *blexpr = (BoolExpr *) lexpr;

  19142.         if (blexpr->boolop == OR_EXPR)
  19143.         {
  19144.             blexpr->args = lappend(blexpr->args, rexpr);
  19145.             return (Node *) blexpr;
  19146.         }
  19147.     }
  19148.     return (Node *) makeBoolExpr(OR_EXPR, list_make2(lexpr, rexpr), location);
  19149. }

  19151. static Node *
  19152. makeNotExpr(Node *expr, int location)
  19153. {
  19154.     return (Node *) makeBoolExpr(NOT_EXPR, list_make1(expr), location);
  19155. }

  19157. static Node *
  19158. makeAArrayExpr(List *elements, int location)
  19159. {
  19160.     A_ArrayExpr *n = makeNode(A_ArrayExpr);

  19162.     n->elements = elements;
  19163.     n->location = location;
  19164.     return (Node *) n;
  19165. }

  19167. static Node *
  19168. makeSQLValueFunction(SQLValueFunctionOp op, int32 typmod, int location)
  19169. {
  19170.     SQLValueFunction *svf = makeNode(SQLValueFunction);

  19172.     svf->op = op;
  19173.     /* svf->type will be filled during parse analysis */
  19174.     svf->typmod = typmod;
  19175.     svf->location = location;
  19176.     return (Node *) svf;
  19177. }

  19179. static Node *
  19180. makeXmlExpr(XmlExprOp op, char *name, List *named_args, List *args,
  19181.             int location)
  19182. {
  19183.     XmlExpr        *x = makeNode(XmlExpr);

  19185.     x->op = op;
  19186.     x->name = name;
  19187.     /*
  19188.      * named_args is a list of ResTarget; it'll be split apart into separate
  19189.      * expression and name lists in transformXmlExpr().
  19190.      */
  19191.     x->named_args = named_args;
  19192.     x->arg_names = NIL;
  19193.     x->args = args;
  19194.     /* xmloption, if relevant, must be filled in by caller */
  19195.     /* type and typmod will be filled in during parse analysis */
  19196.     x->type = InvalidOid;            /* marks the node as not analyzed */
  19197.     x->location = location;
  19198.     return (Node *) x;
  19199. }

  19201. /*
  19202. * Merge the input and output parameters of a table function.
  19203. */
  19204. static List *
  19205. mergeTableFuncParameters(List *func_args, List *columns)
  19206. {
  19207.     ListCell   *lc;

  19209.     /* Explicit OUT and INOUT parameters shouldn't be used in this syntax */
  19210.     foreach(lc, func_args)
  19211.     {
  19212.         FunctionParameter *p = (FunctionParameter *) lfirst(lc);

  19214.         if (p->mode != FUNC_PARAM_DEFAULT &&
  19215.             p->mode != FUNC_PARAM_IN &&
  19216.             p->mode != FUNC_PARAM_VARIADIC)
  19217.             ereport(ERROR,
  19218.                     (errcode(ERRCODE_SYNTAX_ERROR),
  19219.                      errmsg("OUT and INOUT arguments aren't allowed in TABLE functions")));
  19220.     }

  19222.     return list_concat(func_args, columns);
  19223. }

  19225. /*
  19226. * Determine return type of a TABLE function.  A single result column
  19227. * returns setof that column's type; otherwise return setof record.
  19228. */
  19229. static TypeName *
  19230. TableFuncTypeName(List *columns)
  19231. {
  19232.     TypeName   *result;

  19234.     if (list_length(columns) == 1)
  19235.     {
  19236.         FunctionParameter *p = (FunctionParameter *) linitial(columns);

  19238.         result = copyObject(p->argType);
  19239.     }
  19240.     else
  19241.         result = SystemTypeName("record");

  19243.     result->setof = true;

  19245.     return result;
  19246. }

  19248. /*
  19249. * Convert a list of (dotted) names to a RangeVar (like
  19250. * makeRangeVarFromNameList, but with position support).  The
  19251. * "AnyName" refers to the any_name production in the grammar.
  19252. */
  19253. static RangeVar *
  19254. makeRangeVarFromAnyName(List *names, int position, core_yyscan_t yyscanner)
  19255. {
  19256.     RangeVar   *r = makeNode(RangeVar);

  19258.     switch (list_length(names))
  19259.     {
  19260.         case 1:
  19261.             r->catalogname = NULL;
  19262.             r->schemaname = NULL;
  19263.             r->relname = strVal(linitial(names));
  19264.             break;
  19265.         case 2:
  19266.             r->catalogname = NULL;
  19267.             r->schemaname = strVal(linitial(names));
  19268.             r->relname = strVal(lsecond(names));
  19269.             break;
  19270.         case 3:
  19271.             r->catalogname = strVal(linitial(names));
  19272.             r->schemaname = strVal(lsecond(names));
  19273.             r->relname = strVal(lthird(names));
  19274.             break;
  19275.         default:
  19276.             ereport(ERROR,
  19277.                     (errcode(ERRCODE_SYNTAX_ERROR),
  19278.                      errmsg("improper qualified name (too many dotted names): %s",
  19279.                             NameListToString(names)),
  19280.                      parser_errposition(position)));
  19281.             break;
  19282.     }

  19284.     r->relpersistence = RELPERSISTENCE_PERMANENT;
  19285.     r->location = position;

  19287.     return r;
  19288. }

  19290. /*
  19291. * Convert a relation_name with name and namelist to a RangeVar using
  19292. * makeRangeVar.
  19293. */
  19294. static RangeVar *
  19295. makeRangeVarFromQualifiedName(char *name, List *namelist, int location,
  19296.                               core_yyscan_t yyscanner)
  19297. {
  19298.     RangeVar   *r;

  19300.     check_qualified_name(namelist, yyscanner);
  19301.     r = makeRangeVar(NULL, NULL, location);

  19303.     switch (list_length(namelist))
  19304.     {
  19305.         case 1:
  19306.             r->catalogname = NULL;
  19307.             r->schemaname = name;
  19308.             r->relname = strVal(linitial(namelist));
  19309.             break;
  19310.         case 2:
  19311.             r->catalogname = name;
  19312.             r->schemaname = strVal(linitial(namelist));
  19313.             r->relname = strVal(lsecond(namelist));
  19314.             break;
  19315.         default:
  19316.             ereport(ERROR,
  19317.                     errcode(ERRCODE_SYNTAX_ERROR),
  19318.                     errmsg("improper qualified name (too many dotted names): %s",
  19319.                            NameListToString(lcons(makeString(name), namelist))),
  19320.                            parser_errposition(location));
  19321.             break;
  19322.     }

  19324.     return r;
  19325. }

  19327. /* Separate Constraint nodes from COLLATE clauses in a ColQualList */
  19328. static void
  19329. SplitColQualList(List *qualList,
  19330.                  List **constraintList, CollateClause **collClause,
  19331.                  core_yyscan_t yyscanner)
  19332. {
  19333.     ListCell   *cell;

  19335.     *collClause = NULL;
  19336.     foreach(cell, qualList)
  19337.     {
  19338.         Node       *n = (Node *) lfirst(cell);

  19340.         if (IsA(n, Constraint))
  19341.         {
  19342.             /* keep it in list */
  19343.             continue;
  19344.         }
  19345.         if (IsA(n, CollateClause))
  19346.         {
  19347.             CollateClause *c = (CollateClause *) n;

  19349.             if (*collClause)
  19350.                 ereport(ERROR,
  19351.                         (errcode(ERRCODE_SYNTAX_ERROR),
  19352.                          errmsg("multiple COLLATE clauses not allowed"),
  19353.                          parser_errposition(c->location)));
  19354.             *collClause = c;
  19355.         }
  19356.         else
  19357.             elog(ERROR, "unexpected node type %d", (int) n->type);
  19358.         /* remove non-Constraint nodes from qualList */
  19359.         qualList = foreach_delete_current(qualList, cell);
  19360.     }
  19361.     *constraintList = qualList;
  19362. }

  19364. /*
  19365. * Process result of ConstraintAttributeSpec, and set appropriate bool flags
  19366. * in the output command node.  Pass NULL for any flags the particular
  19367. * command doesn't support.
  19368. */
  19369. static void
  19370. processCASbits(int cas_bits, int location, const char *constrType,
  19371.                bool *deferrable, bool *initdeferred, bool *not_valid,
  19372.                bool *no_inherit, core_yyscan_t yyscanner)
  19373. {
  19374.     /* defaults */
  19375.     if (deferrable)
  19376.         *deferrable = false;
  19377.     if (initdeferred)
  19378.         *initdeferred = false;
  19379.     if (not_valid)
  19380.         *not_valid = false;

  19382.     if (cas_bits & (CAS_DEFERRABLE | CAS_INITIALLY_DEFERRED))
  19383.     {
  19384.         if (deferrable)
  19385.             *deferrable = true;
  19386.         else
  19387.             ereport(ERROR,
  19388.                     (errcode(ERRCODE_FEATURE_NOT_SUPPORTED),
  19389.                      /* translator: %s is CHECK, UNIQUE, or similar */
  19390.                      errmsg("%s constraints cannot be marked DEFERRABLE",
  19391.                             constrType),
  19392.                      parser_errposition(location)));
  19393.     }

  19395.     if (cas_bits & CAS_INITIALLY_DEFERRED)
  19396.     {
  19397.         if (initdeferred)
  19398.             *initdeferred = true;
  19399.         else
  19400.             ereport(ERROR,
  19401.                     (errcode(ERRCODE_FEATURE_NOT_SUPPORTED),
  19402.                      /* translator: %s is CHECK, UNIQUE, or similar */
  19403.                      errmsg("%s constraints cannot be marked DEFERRABLE",
  19404.                             constrType),
  19405.                      parser_errposition(location)));
  19406.     }

  19408.     if (cas_bits & CAS_NOT_VALID)
  19409.     {
  19410.         if (not_valid)
  19411.             *not_valid = true;
  19412.         else
  19413.             ereport(ERROR,
  19414.                     (errcode(ERRCODE_FEATURE_NOT_SUPPORTED),
  19415.                      /* translator: %s is CHECK, UNIQUE, or similar */
  19416.                      errmsg("%s constraints cannot be marked NOT VALID",
  19417.                             constrType),
  19418.                      parser_errposition(location)));
  19419.     }

  19421.     if (cas_bits & CAS_NO_INHERIT)
  19422.     {
  19423.         if (no_inherit)
  19424.             *no_inherit = true;
  19425.         else
  19426.             ereport(ERROR,
  19427.                     (errcode(ERRCODE_FEATURE_NOT_SUPPORTED),
  19428.                      /* translator: %s is CHECK, UNIQUE, or similar */
  19429.                      errmsg("%s constraints cannot be marked NO INHERIT",
  19430.                             constrType),
  19431.                      parser_errposition(location)));
  19432.     }
  19433. }

  19435. /*
  19436. * Parse a user-supplied partition strategy string into parse node
  19437. * PartitionStrategy representation, or die trying.
  19438. */
  19439. static PartitionStrategy
  19440. parsePartitionStrategy(char *strategy)
  19441. {
  19442.     if (pg_strcasecmp(strategy, "list") == 0)
  19443.         return PARTITION_STRATEGY_LIST;
  19444.     else if (pg_strcasecmp(strategy, "range") == 0)
  19445.         return PARTITION_STRATEGY_RANGE;
  19446.     else if (pg_strcasecmp(strategy, "hash") == 0)
  19447.         return PARTITION_STRATEGY_HASH;

  19449.     ereport(ERROR,
  19450.             (errcode(ERRCODE_INVALID_PARAMETER_VALUE),
  19451.              errmsg("unrecognized partitioning strategy \"%s\"",
  19452.                     strategy)));
  19453.     return PARTITION_STRATEGY_LIST;        /* keep compiler quiet */

  19455. }

  19457. /*
  19458. * Process pubobjspec_list to check for errors in any of the objects and
  19459. * convert PUBLICATIONOBJ_CONTINUATION into appropriate PublicationObjSpecType.
  19460. */
  19461. static void
  19462. preprocess_pubobj_list(List *pubobjspec_list, core_yyscan_t yyscanner)
  19463. {
  19464.     ListCell   *cell;
  19465.     PublicationObjSpec *pubobj;
  19466.     PublicationObjSpecType prevobjtype = PUBLICATIONOBJ_CONTINUATION;

  19468.     if (!pubobjspec_list)
  19469.         return;

  19471.     pubobj = (PublicationObjSpec *) linitial(pubobjspec_list);
  19472.     if (pubobj->pubobjtype == PUBLICATIONOBJ_CONTINUATION)
  19473.         ereport(ERROR,
  19474.                 errcode(ERRCODE_SYNTAX_ERROR),
  19475.                 errmsg("invalid publication object list"),
  19476.                 errdetail("One of TABLE or TABLES IN SCHEMA must be specified before a standalone table or schema name."),
  19477.                 parser_errposition(pubobj->location));

  19479.     foreach(cell, pubobjspec_list)
  19480.     {
  19481.         pubobj = (PublicationObjSpec *) lfirst(cell);

  19483.         if (pubobj->pubobjtype == PUBLICATIONOBJ_CONTINUATION)
  19484.             pubobj->pubobjtype = prevobjtype;

  19486.         if (pubobj->pubobjtype == PUBLICATIONOBJ_TABLE)
  19487.         {
  19488.             /* relation name or pubtable must be set for this type of object */
  19489.             if (!pubobj->name && !pubobj->pubtable)
  19490.                 ereport(ERROR,
  19491.                         errcode(ERRCODE_SYNTAX_ERROR),
  19492.                         errmsg("invalid table name"),
  19493.                         parser_errposition(pubobj->location));

  19495.             if (pubobj->name)
  19496.             {
  19497.                 /* convert it to PublicationTable */
  19498.                 PublicationTable *pubtable = makeNode(PublicationTable);

  19500.                 pubtable->relation =
  19501.                     makeRangeVar(NULL, pubobj->name, pubobj->location);
  19502.                 pubobj->pubtable = pubtable;
  19503.                 pubobj->name = NULL;
  19504.             }
  19505.         }
  19506.         else if (pubobj->pubobjtype == PUBLICATIONOBJ_TABLES_IN_SCHEMA ||
  19507.                  pubobj->pubobjtype == PUBLICATIONOBJ_TABLES_IN_CUR_SCHEMA)
  19508.         {
  19509.             /* WHERE clause is not allowed on a schema object */
  19510.             if (pubobj->pubtable && pubobj->pubtable->whereClause)
  19511.                 ereport(ERROR,
  19512.                         errcode(ERRCODE_SYNTAX_ERROR),
  19513.                         errmsg("WHERE clause not allowed for schema"),
  19514.                         parser_errposition(pubobj->location));

  19516.             /* Column list is not allowed on a schema object */
  19517.             if (pubobj->pubtable && pubobj->pubtable->columns)
  19518.                 ereport(ERROR,
  19519.                         errcode(ERRCODE_SYNTAX_ERROR),
  19520.                         errmsg("column specification not allowed for schema"),
  19521.                         parser_errposition(pubobj->location));

  19523.             /*
  19524.              * We can distinguish between the different type of schema
  19525.              * objects based on whether name and pubtable is set.
  19526.              */
  19527.             if (pubobj->name)
  19528.                 pubobj->pubobjtype = PUBLICATIONOBJ_TABLES_IN_SCHEMA;
  19529.             else if (!pubobj->name && !pubobj->pubtable)
  19530.                 pubobj->pubobjtype = PUBLICATIONOBJ_TABLES_IN_CUR_SCHEMA;
  19531.             else
  19532.                 ereport(ERROR,
  19533.                         errcode(ERRCODE_SYNTAX_ERROR),
  19534.                         errmsg("invalid schema name"),
  19535.                         parser_errposition(pubobj->location));
  19536.         }

  19538.         prevobjtype = pubobj->pubobjtype;
  19539.     }
  19540. }

  19542. /*----------
  19543. * Recursive view transformation
  19544. *
  19545. * Convert
  19546. *
  19547. *     CREATE RECURSIVE VIEW relname (aliases) AS query
  19548. *
  19549. * to
  19550. *
  19551. *     CREATE VIEW relname (aliases) AS
  19552. *         WITH RECURSIVE relname (aliases) AS (query)
  19553. *         SELECT aliases FROM relname
  19554. *
  19555. * Actually, just the WITH ... part, which is then inserted into the original
  19556. * view definition as the query.
  19557. * ----------
  19558. */
  19559. static Node *
  19560. makeRecursiveViewSelect(char *relname, List *aliases, Node *query)
  19561. {
  19562.     SelectStmt *s = makeNode(SelectStmt);
  19563.     WithClause *w = makeNode(WithClause);
  19564.     CommonTableExpr *cte = makeNode(CommonTableExpr);
  19565.     List       *tl = NIL;
  19566.     ListCell   *lc;

  19568.     /* create common table expression */
  19569.     cte->ctename = relname;
  19570.     cte->aliascolnames = aliases;
  19571.     cte->ctematerialized = CTEMaterializeDefault;
  19572.     cte->ctequery = query;
  19573.     cte->location = -1;

  19575.     /* create WITH clause and attach CTE */
  19576.     w->recursive = true;
  19577.     w->ctes = list_make1(cte);
  19578.     w->location = -1;

  19580.     /* create target list for the new SELECT from the alias list of the
  19581.      * recursive view specification */
  19582.     foreach (lc, aliases)
  19583.     {
  19584.         ResTarget *rt = makeNode(ResTarget);

  19586.         rt->name = NULL;
  19587.         rt->indirection = NIL;
  19588.         rt->val = makeColumnRef(strVal(lfirst(lc)), NIL, -1, 0);
  19589.         rt->location = -1;

  19591.         tl = lappend(tl, rt);
  19592.     }

  19594.     /* create new SELECT combining WITH clause, target list, and fake FROM
  19595.      * clause */
  19596.     s->withClause = w;
  19597.     s->targetList = tl;
  19598.     s->fromClause = list_make1(makeRangeVar(NULL, relname, -1));

  19600.     return (Node *) s;
  19601. }

  19603. /* parser_init()
  19604. * Initialize to parse one query string
  19605. */
  19606. void
  19607. parser_init(base_yy_extra_type *yyext)
  19608. {
  19609.     yyext->parsetree = NIL;        /* in case grammar forgets to set it */
  19610. }

One Level Up Top Level
